q: What is the primary goal of VMware Cloud Foundation (VCF)?
explain: VCF delivers a full Software-Defined Data Center (SDDC).

q: Which components are core parts of VCF?
explain: VCF core components are vSphere, vSAN, and NSX.

q: Which domain must be deployed first in VCF?
explain: The Management Domain is mandatory and deployed first.

q: Which tool deploys and manages VCF?
explain: SDDC Manager handles deployment and lifecycle management.

q: Which storage solution is mandatory in VCF?
explain: vSAN is required for all VCF deployments.

q: Which networking technology is required in VCF?
explain: NSX provides network virtualization in VCF.

q: Which lifecycle tasks does SDDC Manager perform?
explain: SDDC Manager manages infrastructure lifecycle operations.

q: What protocol is required during VCF bring-up for host discovery?
explain: DHCP is required during initial bring-up.

q: What is the minimum number of hosts for the Management Domain?
explain: Management Domain requires at least 3 hosts.

q: Which vCenter manages the Management Domain?
explain: The Management Domain uses an embedded vCenter.

q: Which domains are valid Workload Domains in VCF?
explain: VCF supports Management and VI Workload Domains.

q: Which component provides centralized identity in VCF?
explain: Identity Manager integrates authentication services.

q: Which certificate authority is used in VCF by default?
explain: VCF uses self-signed certificates by default.

q: What is a VI Workload Domain used for?
explain: VI Workload Domains host customer workloads.

q: Which VCF component manages certificates and passwords?
explain: SDDC Manager manages credentials and certificates.

q: Which deployment model does VCF follow?
explain: VCF focuses on infrastructure lifecycle automation.

q: Which prerequisites are required before VCF bring-up?
explain: DNS, NTP, and DHCP are mandatory prerequisites.

q: Which API does SDDC Manager expose?
explain: SDDC Manager provides REST APIs.

q: What happens if bring-up validation fails?
explain: Bring-up stops if validation fails.

q: Which role is required to deploy VCF?
explain: SDDC Manager Admin is required for deployment.

q: Which lifecycle operation upgrades ESXi hosts in VCF?
explain: SDDC Manager orchestrates ESXi upgrades.

q: Which VCF feature ensures version compatibility?
explain: BOM defines validated component versions.

q: Which operations are Day-2 operations?
explain: Day-2 covers ongoing operations, not initial bring-up.

q: Which component provides centralized logging in VCF?
explain: Log Insight provides centralized logging.

q: Which licensing model does VCF use?
explain: VCF licensing is per physical CPU.

q: Which failure domain concept is used by vSAN?
explain: vSAN supports rack-level fault domains.

q: Which component handles north-south traffic in NSX?
explain: Tier-0 gateways handle north-south traffic.

q: Which feature isolates tenants in VCF?
explain: NSX provides network isolation.

q: Which VCF component manages host commissioning?
explain: SDDC Manager commissions hosts.

q: Which VCF release artifact defines supported versions?
explain: The BOM defines supported versions.
